title: 109_hr377
content: The Act may be cited as the "Honoring Every Requirement of Exemplary Service Act of 2005" or the "HEROES Act of 2005". Death gratuity enhancements are included in the Act. The "HEROES Act of 2005" includes death gratuity enhancements, increasing the death gratuity to $100,000 for deaths resulting from combat-related causes or causes incurred in designated operations or areas. The "HEROES Act of 2005" increases death gratuity to $100,000 for combat-related deaths or deaths in designated operations or areas. Amendments include adjustments in death gratuity amounts and additional gratuity for deaths before the effective date. The Secretary of the military department shall pay an additional death gratuity of $238,000 to members of the Armed Forces who died as a direct result of wounds, injuries, or illnesses incurred in specific operations or after October 7, 2001. The additional death gratuity of $238,000 is payable to beneficiaries entitled under section 1477 of title 10, United States Code, for members who died as a result of wounds, injuries, or illnesses incurred after October 7, 2001. If there are multiple beneficiaries, the amount each receives is based on the ratio of their regular military death gratuity share to the total amount payable. The regular military death gratuity share for a beneficiary is determined by the ratio of their share to the total amount payable to all beneficiaries. Definitions include "additional death gratuity" and "regular military death gratuity" as per Title 10, United States Code. SEC. 3. SERVICEMEMBERS' GROUP LIFE INSURANCE ENHANCEMENTS. Increased Maximum Amount Under Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance to $400,000 and additional amount for members serving in certain areas or operations. The maximum amount under Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance is increased to $400,000. Members serving in specific combat operations or zones are eligible for an additional insurance amount if they die as a result of wounds, injuries, or illnesses incurred during their service. The maximum amount of insurance under Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance is $400,000. Members serving in designated combat operations or areas can receive an additional $150,000 in insurance coverage, with a total limit of $400,000. Contributions towards the $150,000 coverage are specified in the regulations. Members serving in designated combat operations or areas can receive an additional $150,000 in insurance coverage, with contributions specified in regulations. Coordination with VGLI is also amended. Members serving in designated combat operations or areas can receive an additional $150,000 in insurance coverage, with contributions specified in regulations. Amendments include increasing coverage to $400,000 and setting requirements for members to reduce or decline insurance. Amendments include increasing coverage to $400,000 and setting requirements for members to reduce or decline insurance. Regulations now require written consent from a member's spouse for any changes to insurance coverage or beneficiaries. The new amendment states that a member with a spouse cannot change their designated beneficiaries without the written consent of the spouse. This amendment will take effect 90 days after the enactment of the Act.
